question: Which two are characteristics of the Transfer Object design pattern? (Choose two.)

options.A: It reduces network traffic by collapsing multiple remote requests into one.
options.B: It increases the complexity of the remote interface by removing coarse-grained methods.
options.C: It increases the complexity of the design due to remote synchronization and version control issues.
options.D: It increases network performance introducing multiple fine-grained remote requests which return very small amounts of data.
